relation: Do one of the following: ping mpls ipv4 destination-address /destination-mask-length [repeat count] [exp exp-bits] [verbose] trace mpls ipv4 destination-address /destination-mask-length Example: Router# ping mpls ipv4 10.131.191.252/32 exp 5 repeat 5 verbose Example: Router# trace mpls ipv4 10.131.191.252/32
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Selects an LDP IPv4 prefix FEC for validation.
pageTitle: MPLS LSP Ping Traceroute for LDP TE and LSP Ping for VCCV  [Support] - Cisco Systems
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {120628=Router# ping mpls ipv4 10.131.159.251/32 destination 127.0.0.1 127.0.0.2 1 repeat 2 sweep 1450 1475 25, 271146=The IP MTU in the show interface interface-name example is 1500 bytes. Subtract the number of bytes corresponding to the label stack from the MTU number. The output of the show mpls forwarding command indicates that the Tag stack consists of one label (21). Therefore, the largest MPLS echo request packet that can be sent in the LSP is 1500 - (2 x 4) = 1492., 272564=In this command, echo packets that have a range in size from 1492 to 1500 bytes are sent to the destination address. Only packets of 1492 bytes are sent successfully, as indicated by the exclamation point (!). Packets of byte sizes 1493 to 1500 are source-quenched, as indicated by the Qs., 318424=RFC 2113}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 3.    exit trace mpls ipv4 destination-address /destination-mask-length ping mpls ipv4 destination-address /destination-mask-length [repeat count] [exp exp-bits] [verbose] 2.   Do one of the following: 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS Validating an LDP IPv4 FEC by Using MPLS LSP Ping and MPLS LSP Traceroute Returns to global configuration mode.   Router(config-mpls)# exit   Example: exit Step 6 Sends the Cisco-specific extension of TLVs with echo packets.   Router(config-mpls)# echo vendor-extension   Example: echo vendor-extension Step 5
textAfterTable: Validating a Layer 2 FEC by Using MPLS LSP Ping and MPLS LSP Traceroute SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    ping mpls pseudowire ipv4-address vc-id vc-id 3.    exit DETAILED STEPS   Command or Action Purpose Step 1 enable Example: Router> enable   Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.   Step 2 ping mpls pseudowire ipv4-address vc-id vc-id Example: Router# ping mpls pseudowire 10.131.191.252 vc-id 333   Selects a Layer 2 FEC for validation.
